reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: Youth empowerment to access employment opportunities project in Burao and Erigavo in Somaliland

description.narrative: According to the estimations, 90-98 percent of the girls in Somaliland are victims of FGM at the age of 6 to 9. FGM is a deeply rooted harmful traditional practice in which the girls’ genitals are either damaged or removed. In the most serious case the g enitals are closed after the cutting. FGM causes lifelong physical and psychological problems to the girls and women. It is also a human rights violation. The initial project purpose is to support the project implemented by CLHE on the reduction of the FGM cases on the national level. The project is implemented by a network that brings together all the actors carrying out FGM projects in Somaliland, Network against FGM/C in Somaliland (NAFIS). NAFIS coordinates the work of the actors that work on the elimin ation of FGM in Somaliland and strengthens networking between them. It also has a signigicant role in advocating for the illegalization of FGM in Somaliland. In addition to this, NAFIS produces national level studies on FGM and supports capacity building o f its member organizations. The specific thematic, beneficiaries, purpose and expected results of the project will be defined more specifically during the project planning phase, which precedes the project implementation phase.
